metadata.feature_description: Provides connector metadata including name, icon, category for display in the connectors management UI

steps.actual: Connectors list displayed with all available connectors

steps.action: Locate Google Tag Manager connector in the list
steps.expected: Connector should display with name 'Google Tag Manager'
steps.actual: Connector displays as 'GOOGLE TAG MANAGER' (uppercase styling applied by UI)

steps.action: View Google Tag Manager connector in Connectors list
steps.actual: Blue diamond/hexagonal Google Tag Manager icon is displayed next to the connector name

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify connector appears in Marketing category

steps.action: View Google Tag Manager connector position in Connectors list
steps.expected: Connector should appear grouped with other marketing connectors
steps.actual: Connector appears in alphabetical order near other marketing-related connectors (Google Analytics 4, Mailchimp, Marketo, Optimizely). Note: UI does not display explicit category headers but connector is properly categorized internally as 'Marketing' per code review

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify connector doesn't support multiple instances

steps.action: View Google Tag Manager connector in Connectors list
steps.expected: Only one instance of the connector should be shown without option to add more
steps.actual: Single connector instance displayed with 'Connect' button. No 'Add' or '+' button present to create additional instances. This confirms SupportsMultiple = false as defined in code

observations: Code review confirms IsEngageConnector = false, but this property is not visible in the UI. It is an internal property that affects connector behavior but has no UI representation to verify.

The Connectors UI displays all connectors in a flat alphabetical list without visible category headers or groupings. The ConnectorCategories.Marketting value is used internally for filtering/sorting but is not explicitly shown to users.
The display name in code is 'Google Tag Manager' but the UI renders it as 'GOOGLE TAG MANAGER' (uppercase) due to CSS text-transform styling applied to the connector list.
